article.headline: S.C.-Upstate 69, North Florida 64
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Bobby Davis scored 24 points and grabbed 16 rebounds to lead South Carolina-Upstate to a 69-64 win over North Florida on Saturday. Davis, who had 10 offensive rebounds, made 14 of his 16 free throws and shot 5 of 9 from the field for the Spartans (2-10, 1-2 Atlantic Sun Conference). Josh Chavis scored 13 points and Nick Schneiders added 11. S.C.-Upstate took a 59-42 lead with 5:39 left in second half after Mezie Uzochukwu's free throw. The Ospreys (2-11, 0-3) scored 10 straight points, trimming the margin down to seven points with 2:49 remaining on a 3-pointer by Cameron Lovelace, who finished with 11 points. Stan Januska made a jumper to cut the lead to 62-58 with 44 seconds left in the game. But North Florida pulled no closer as Chavis made two free throws to help S.C.-Upstate seal the victory. Cortez Riley scored 17 points for North Florida.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
